alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 29 at 2:15PM PST until December 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 4500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 8 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 4500 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 20 inches possible with 20 to 40 inches possible above 5000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM Thursday to 4 AM PST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Thursday night through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
